summary: This document outlines the plea agreement and sentencing terms for Jeffrey Epstein in relation to charges of solicitation of prostitution. It details the conditions of his community control, including restrictions on contact with minors and requirements for monitoring and reporting. The document also includes provisions for electronic monitoring and the obligations Epstein must fulfill as a convicted sexual offender. This document outlines the special conditions of probation for Jeffrey Epstein following his conviction. It includes requirements for drug and alcohol evaluation, restitution to victims, community service, and restrictions on contact with minors and victims. The document emphasizes the importance of compliance with these conditions to avoid further legal consequences. This document contains sentencing details for Jeffrey Epstein in the Circuit Court of the Fifteenth Judicial Circuit in Palm Beach County, Florida. It outlines the court's orders regarding fines, incarceration, and the revocation of driving privileges, as well as the defendant's rights to appeal the sentence.

events.title: Plea Agreement and Sentencing
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein entered a guilty plea to charges of solicitation of prostitution and was sentenced to jail time followed by community control.

events.title: Court Ordered Probation Conditions
events.description: The court ordered specific conditions for Jeffrey Epstein's probation, including drug treatment, community service, and restrictions on contact with victims.

events.title: Plea Conference
events.description: A plea conference was held where the court ordered certain documents to be sealed.

events.title: Sentencing of Jeffrey Epstein
events.description: The court sentenced Jeffrey Epstein, imposing fines and incarceration terms, and revoking his driving privileges.

keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein was sentenced to 12 months in jail followed by 6 months of community control.
As part of his community control, Epstein is prohibited from having unsupervised contact with minors.
Epstein must comply with electronic monitoring and report to his probation officer regularly.
The court ordered that Epstein must provide a DNA sample as part of his sentencing conditions.
The document includes provisions for restitution to the victim as ordered by the court.
Jeffrey Epstein must undergo a drug and alcohol evaluation and complete treatment if necessary.
He is required to make restitution to victims as directed by the court.
Epstein must not have any unsupervised contact with minors or victims during his probation.
He is mandated to participate in community service and maintain full-time employment or schooling.
The document outlines various conditions for electronic monitoring and compliance with treatment programs.
Jeffrey Epstein was adjudicated guilty and sentenced by the court.
The court ordered Epstein to pay fines and serve a term of incarceration.
The court revoked Epstein's driving privileges as part of the sentencing.
Judge Deborah D. Pucillo presided over the plea conference and sentencing.
Certain documents related to the case were ordered to be sealed by the court.
